sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | परं भूयः प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम् | यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः ||1||
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
paraṁ bhūyaḥ pravakṣhyāmi jñānānāṁ jñānam uttamam
yaj jñātvā munayaḥ sarve parāṁ siddhim ito gatāḥ
translation: The Blessed Lord said: I shall now declare to you the supreme knowledge, the best of all knowledge, knowing which all the sages have attained the highest perfection.

sanskrit: इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागताः | सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च ||2||
transliteration:
idaṁ jñānam upāśhritya mama sādharmyam āgatāḥ
sarge ’pi nopajāyante pralaye na vyathanti cha
translation: Those who take refuge in this knowledge attain unity with Me. They are not born at the time of creation, nor are they disturbed at the time of dissolution.

sanskrit: मम योनिर्महद्ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् | सम्भवः सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत ||3||
transliteration:
mama yonir mahad brahma tasmin garbhaṁ dadhāmy aham
sambhavaḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ tato bhavati bhārata
translation: The total material substance, called Brahman, is My womb. I impregnate it, and from it all living beings are born, O Bharata.

sanskrit: सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तयः सम्भवन्ति याः | तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रदः पिता ||4||
transliteration:
sarva-yoniṣhu kaunteya mūrtayaḥ sambhavanti yāḥ
tāsāṁ brahma mahad yonir ahaṁ bīja-pradaḥ pitā
translation: O son of Kunti, whatever forms are produced in all wombs, the great material nature is their womb, and I am the seed-giving father.

sanskrit: सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणाः प्रकृतिसम्भवाः | निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम् ||5||
transliteration:
sattvaṁ rajas tama iti guṇāḥ prakṛiti-sambhavāḥ
nibadhnanti mahā-bāho dehe dehinam avyayam
translation: The three modes—goodness, passion, and ignorance—arise from material nature. They bind the imperishable soul to the body, O mighty-armed one.

sanskrit: तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम् | सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ ||6||
transliteration:
tatra sattvaṁ nirmalatvāt prakāśhakam anāmayam
sukha-saṅgena badhnāti jñāna-saṅgena chānagha
translation: Of these, the mode of goodness is pure and illuminating. It binds the soul through attachment to happiness and knowledge, O sinless one.

sanskrit: रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम् | तन्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम् ||7||
transliteration:
rajo rāgātmakaṁ viddhi tṛiṣhṇā-saṅga-samudbhavam
tan nibadhnāti kaunteya karma-saṅgena dehinam
translation: Know that the mode of passion is born of desire and attachment. It binds the soul through attachment to action and its fruits, O son of Kunti.

sanskrit: तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम् | प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत ||8||
transliteration:
tamas tv ajñāna-jaṁ viddhi mohanaṁ sarva-dehinām
pramādālasya-nidrābhis tan nibadhnāti bhārata
translation: And know that the mode of ignorance is born of darkness. It deludes all embodied beings and binds them through negligence, laziness, and sleep.

sanskrit: सत्त्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रजः कर्मणि भारत | ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तमः प्रमादे सञ्जयत्युत ||9||
transliteration:
sattvaṁ sukhe sañjayati rajaḥ karmaṇi bhārata
jñānam āvṛitya tu tamaḥ pramāde sañjayaty uta
translation: Sattva binds one to happiness, rajas to action, and tamas, covering knowledge, binds one to delusion.

sanskrit: रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत | रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा ||10||
transliteration:
rajas tamaśh chābhibhūya sattvaṁ bhavati bhārata
rajaḥ sattvaṁ tamaśh chaiva tamaḥ sattvaṁ rajas tathā
translation: Sometimes sattva prevails by suppressing rajas and tamas; sometimes rajas dominates by suppressing sattva and tamas; and sometimes tamas prevails by suppressing sattva and rajas.

sanskrit: सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते | ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत ||11||
transliteration:
sarva-dvāreṣhu dehe ’smin prakāśha upajāyate
jñānaṁ yadā tadā vidyād vivṛiddhaṁ sattvam ity uta
translation: When the light of knowledge shines through all the gates of the body, then it should be known that sattva is predominant.

sanskrit: लोभः प्रवृत्तिरारम्भः कर्मणामशमः स्पृहा | रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ ||12||
transliteration:
lobhaḥ pravṛittir ārambhaḥ karmaṇām aśhamaḥ spṛihā
rajasy etāni jāyante vivṛiddhe bharatarṣhabha
translation: Greed, activity, undertaking of works, restlessness, and craving—these arise when the mode of passion is predominant, O best of the Bharatas.

sanskrit: अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च | तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन ||13||
transliteration:
aprakāśho ’pravṛittiśh cha pramādo moha eva cha
tamasy etāni jāyante vivṛiddhe kuru-nandana
translation: Darkness, inertia, negligence, and delusion arise when the mode of ignorance is predominant, O joy of the Kurus.

sanskrit: यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् | तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते ||14||
transliteration:
yadā sattve pravṛiddhe tu pralayaṁ yāti deha-bhṛit
tadottama-vidāṁ lokān amalān pratipadyate
translation: When one dies in the mode of goodness, he attains the pure higher planets of the great sages.

sanskrit: रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते | तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते ||15||
transliteration:
rajasi pralayaṁ gatvā karma-saṅgiṣhu jāyate
tathā pralīnas tamasi mūḍha-yoṇiṣhu jāyate
translation: Dying in the mode of passion, one is born among those attached to work. Dying in ignorance, one takes birth in the animal kingdom.

sanskrit: कर्मणः सुकृतस्याहुः सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम् | रजसस्तु फलं दुःखमज्ञानं तमसः फलम् ||16||
transliteration:
karmaṇaḥ sukṛitasyāhuḥ sāttvikaṁ nirmalaṁ phalam
rajasas tu phalaṁ duḥkham ajñānaṁ tamasaḥ phalam
translation: The fruit of good action is said to be pure and sattvic; the fruit of passion is misery; and the fruit of ignorance is darkness.

sanskrit: सत्त्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च | प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च ||17||
transliteration:
sattvāt sañjāyate jñānaṁ rajaso lobha eva cha
pramāda-mohau tamaso bhavato ’jñānam eva cha
translation: From sattva arises knowledge; from rajas, greed; and from tamas arise negligence, delusion, and ignorance.

sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसाः | जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसाः ||18||
transliteration:
ūrdhvaṁ gachchhanti sattva-sthā madhye tiṣhṭhanti rājasāḥ
jaghanya-guṇa-vṛitti-sthā adho gachchhanti tāmasāḥ
translation: Those situated in sattva rise upward; those in rajas remain in the middle; and those in tamas go downward.

sanskrit: नान्यं गुणेभ्यः कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति | गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति ||19||
transliteration:
nānyaṁ guṇebhyaḥ kartāraṁ yadā draṣṭānupaśhyati
guṇebhyaśh cha paraṁ vetti mad-bhāvaṁ so ’dhigachchhati
translation: When one sees no doer other than the modes of nature and knows the Supreme beyond these modes, he attains My divine nature.

sanskrit: गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्देही देहसमुद्भवान् | जन्ममृत्युजरादुःखैर्विमुक्तोऽमृतमश्नुते ||20||
transliteration:
guṇān etān atītya trīn dehī deha-samudbhavān
janma-mṛityu-jarā-duḥkhair vimukto ’mṛitam aśhnute
translation: When the embodied soul rises above these three modes, which originate in the body, he is freed from birth, death, old age, and suffering, and attains immortality.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | कैर्लिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो | किमाचारः कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते ||21||
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
kair liṅgais trīn guṇān etān atīto bhavati prabho
kim āchāraḥ kathaṁ chaitāṁs trīn guṇān ativartate
translation: Arjuna said: O Lord, by what signs is one known who has transcended the three modes? What is his behavior, and how does he go beyond them?

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव | न द्वेष्टि सम्प्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति ||22||
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
prakāśhaṁ cha pravṛittiṁ cha moham eva cha pāṇḍava
na dveṣhṭi sampravṛittāni na nivṛittāni kāṅkṣhati
translation: The Blessed Lord said: O Arjuna, he who does not hate illumination, activity, or delusion when they appear, nor longs for them when they disappear...

sanskrit: उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते | गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येवं योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते ||23||
transliteration:
udāsīna-vad āsīno guṇair yo na vichālyate
guṇā vartanta ity evaṁ yo ’vatiṣhṭhati neṅgate
translation: He who sits like one unconcerned, unshaken by the modes, knowing that it is the modes which act, and remains firm and unmoved...

sanskrit: समदुःखसुखः स्वस्थः समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः | तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुतिः ||24||
transliteration:
sama-duḥkha-sukhaḥ svasthaḥ sama-loṣhṭāśhma-kāñchanaḥ
tulya-priyāpriyo dhīras tulya-nindātma-saṁstutiḥ
translation: He who is equal in pleasure and pain, self-contained, equal to a clod, stone, or gold, the same to loved and unloved, steady, and equal in praise and blame...

sanskrit: मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयोः | सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीतः स उच्यते ||25||
transliteration:
mānāpamānayos tulyaḥ tulyo mitrāri-pakṣhayoḥ
sarvārambha-parityāgī guṇātītaḥ sa uchyate
translation: He who is equal in honor and dishonor, equal to friend and foe, renounces all undertakings—such a person is said to have transcended the modes of nature.

sanskrit: मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते | स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ||26||
transliteration:
māṁ cha yo ’vyabhichāreṇa bhakti-yogena sevate
sa guṇān samatītyaitān brahma-bhūyāya kalpate
translation: He who serves Me with unwavering devotion, transcending these modes, becomes fit to attain the nature of Brahman.

sanskrit: ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च | शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च ||27||
transliteration:
brahmaṇo hi pratiṣṭhāham amṛitasya avyayasya cha
śhāśvatasya cha dharmasya sukhasyaikāntikasya cha
translation: For I am the foundation of the formless Brahman, the immortal, the imperishable, the eternal dharma, and the unending bliss.
